channel.title: python on Shenlong616
channel.description: Recent content in python on Shenlong616

item.title: Function argument unpacking in Python
item.description: def myfunc(x, y, z): print(x, y, z) tuple_vec = (1, 0, 1) dict_vec = {"x": 1, "y": 0, "z": 1} myfunc(*tuple_vec) # 1 0 1 myfunc(**dict_vec) # 1 0 1

item.title: How to merge two dictionaries in Python
Multiple sets of kwargs in Python 3.5+
item.description: Python 3.5+ allows passing multiple sets of keyword arguments (kwargs) to a function within a single call

item.title: Python 3 tricks by alexghergh
item.description: Python 3 tricks Disclaimer: This list is meant as a comprehension of cool tips and tricks I found on the internet. If you would like to contribute, or notice any mistakes or typos, please contact me or upload a pull request. If you think any material here can be considered personal property let me know and I will take it down. 1. Looping over a range of numbers Using range() is better than using a list (ex.
